org.eclipse.keyple.core.util

Interface Configurable

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ObservablePlugin, ObservableReader, ProxyReader, ReaderPlugin, ReaderPoolPlugin, SeReader, SmartInsertionReader, SmartRemovalReader, SmartSelectionReader
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractLocalReader, AbstractObservableLocalReader, AbstractPlugin, AbstractReader, AbstractThreadedObservablePlugin

    public interface Configurable
    Allow ProxyReaders and ReaderPlugins to receive configuration parameters.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getParameters()
      Gets the parameters
      void setParameter(java.lang.String key, java.lang.String value)
      allows to define a proprietary setting for a reader or a plugin (contactless protocols polling sequence, baud rate, … etc.).
      void setParameters(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parameters)
      allows to define a set of proprietary settings for a reader or a plugin (contactless protocols polling sequence, baud rate, … etc.).

    • Method Detail

      • getParameters

        Gets the parameters
        Returns:
        the configuration of the item

      • setParameter

        void setParameter(java.lang.String key,
                  java.lang.String value)
           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                  KeypleBaseException
        allows to define a proprietary setting for a reader or a plugin (contactless protocols polling sequence, baud rate, … etc.).
        Parameters:
        key - the parameter key
        value - the parameter value
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the parameter or the value is not supported
        KeypleBaseException - if the parameter fails to be set up

      • setParameters

        void setParameters(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parameters)
            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                   KeypleBaseException
        allows to define a set of proprietary settings for a reader or a plugin (contactless protocols polling sequence, baud rate, … etc.).
        Parameters:
        parameters - Parameters to setup
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the parameters or the values is not supported
        KeypleBaseException - if the parameter fails to be set up
